page.title: 04Bridgerule Methodist Church
page.content: In September 1932, the Uniting Conference of the Methodist Church was held in London, and former Wesleyans, Primitive Methodists and United Methodists became members of one Church. There were two chapels in Bridgerule at the time of union and in or about 1941 the former Wesleyan chapel was closed and the members united with the former United Methodist society to form the present church. So the division of 1815 was healed after 126 years of separation. The old Wesleyan chapel was sold to the parish council and is now in use as a parish hall. In 1951 a further addition to the chapel was made by the installation of a pipe organ.
